Class World

java.lang.Object
World
All Implemented Interfaces:
Tickable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Dialog
public abstract class World
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tickable
The world everything takes place in. Different Elements can be added, moved and others. It creates events once a key is pressed or an element is clicked on.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static Engine e
    The engine the world is running on.
    boolean hardEdge
    If the world border is a hard edge.
    int height
    The amount of fields on the x axis
    static GameUI mainframe
    The frame, every world is drawn on.
    java.util.Collection<WorldObj> objects
    All objects in the world.
    int pixelSize
    The size of each field.
    java.util.Random random
    the random number generator of the world.
    WorldUI ui
    The ui of the world.
    int width
    The amount of fields on the x axis

  • Field Details

    • pixelSize

      public int pixelSize
      The size of each field.

    • width

      public int width
      The amount of fields on the x axis

    • height

      public int height
      The amount of fields on the x axis

    • objects

      public java.util.Collection<WorldObj> objects
      All objects in the world.

    • e

      public static Engine e
      The engine the world is running on. Default amount of ticks per second: 20

    • hardEdge

      public boolean hardEdge
      If the world border is a hard edge. Hard edge means, one is unable to go out of bounds, but stays at the border. Default value: {@link false}

    • ui

      public WorldUI ui
      The ui of the world. used to draw and Show the world.

    • mainframe

      public static GameUI mainframe
      The frame, every world is drawn on.

    • random

      public java.util.Random random
      the random number generator of the world.

    • World

      public World()
      generates a standard world of 10x10 fields, 16 pixel width/height each.

      public World​(int width, int height, int pixelSize)
      generates a new world.
      Parameters:
      width - amount of fields in the x axis
      height - amount of fields at the y axis
      pixelSize - the size of each field.

    • setBackgroundOpaqueness

      public final void setBackgroundOpaqueness​(double opaque)
      sets the background opaqueness of the world. a value less than 1 results in a fading of the drawn images
      Parameters:
      opaque - opaqueness to set to
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the opaquness is not between (inclusive) 0 and 1
